Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2018 07:59AM holliewood wrote: I have. Yesterday I got the test results from my bone scan, which said no mets found. The adrenaline dump nearly made me cry and I ended up exhausted in the afternoon. I have not hit depression (yet?), and may not as I am usually a glass half full kind of person, but the exhaustion, for sure. It's not just the incident itself, it the underlying constant strain of wondering, thinking and worry. That all adds up and takes a toll. Be nice to yourself, do what you need to in order to get past this. Big hugs to you and congrats on the good news!!
Posts.Title: Exhausted/the blues AFTER benign findings??!? Egads007 AliceBastable

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2018 03:51AM holliewood wrote: virtual hand holding from me here. It's so frightening to wait.....big hug
Posts.Title: so afraid jesus4201 holliewood

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2018 11:54AM holliewood wrote: Lynne, I am so sorry you had such a horrible experience with the port surgery. When mine was done, I had "twilight" sedation, but apparently I got combative so they ended up tubing me. I don't remember a thing. My port is also not uncomfortable and I'm super glad to have it as I think it's probably better for my chemo. Hope things look up for you!
